intro: Raphionacme vignei, commonly known as the Vignei's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are often hairy. Raphionacme vignei thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
